content:
INDUSTRIAL PUMP & EQUIPMENT OPERATIONS MANUAL
==============================================

NORMAL OPERATING RANGES:
- Temperature: 60-75°C
  Warning above 80°C
  Critical above 90°C
  Immediate shutdown above 95°C

- Vibration: 1.0-2.5 mm/s
  Warning above 3.0 mm/s
  Critical above 4.0 mm/s
  Immediate shutdown above 5.0 mm/s

- Pressure: 3.5-5.0 bar
  Warning below 3.0 bar
  Critical below 2.5 bar
  Immediate shutdown below 2.0 bar

- RPM: 1400-1500
  Warning below 1350

COMMON ISSUES AND CAUSES:

1. HIGH TEMPERATURE
   Possible Causes:
   - Blocked cooling fins or vents
   - Low coolant level
   - Failed cooling fan
   - Bearing friction due to wear
   - Overloading beyond rated capacity
   
   Immediate Actions:
   - Reduce machine load by 20%
   - Check coolant levels immediately
   - Inspect cooling fan operation
   - If temperature exceeds 90°C shut down within 10 minutes
   - If temperature exceeds 95°C shut down immediately

2. HIGH VIBRATION
   Possible Causes:
   - Worn or damaged bearings
   - Shaft misalignment
   - Loose mounting bolts
   - Imbalanced rotating components
   - Cavitation in pump
   
   Immediate Actions:
   - Stop machine for visual inspection
   - Check all mounting bolts for tightness
   - Inspect bearing condition
   - Check shaft alignment with alignment tool
   - If vibration exceeds 4.0 mm/s replace bearings immediately

3. LOW PRESSURE
   Possible Causes:
   - Leaking seals or gaskets
   - Blocked inlet valve
   - Worn pump impeller
   - Air trapped in system
   - Pipe leakage
   
   Immediate Actions:
   - Check all connection points for visible leaks
   - Inspect inlet and outlet valves
   - Bleed air from system
   - Check seal integrity
   - Verify pump impeller condition

MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE:
- Daily:   Visual inspection, oil level check
- Weekly:  Lubrication, filter inspection
- Monthly: Full bearing inspection, alignment check
- Quarterly: Complete overhaul and inspection

SPARE PARTS LIST:
- Bearing set (replace every 6 months)
- Shaft seals (replace every 3 months)
- Cooling fan belt (replace every 12 months)
- Filter cartridge (replace monthly)

TROUBLESHOOTING QUICK REFERENCE GUIDE
======================================

EMERGENCY PROCEDURES:
If any machine reaches DANGER level (health score below 40%):
1. Alert supervisor immediately
2. Prepare for controlled shutdown
3. Do NOT restart without full inspection

─────────────────────────────────────

SYMPTOM: Temperature above 80°C (WARNING)
Priority: Medium

Step 1: Check coolant level in reservoir
Step 2: Inspect cooling fan — is it spinning?
Step 3: Clean any dust from cooling fins
Step 4: Reduce machine load by 20%
Step 5: Monitor for 15 minutes
Step 6: If temperature drops below 75°C — continue monitoring
Step 7: If temperature stays above 80°C — escalate to CRITICAL procedure

SYMPTOM: Temperature above 90°C (CRITICAL)
Priority: High

Step 1: Reduce machine load to minimum immediately
Step 2: Check coolant — top up if below minimum line
Step 3: Check cooling fan belt — replace if worn
Step 4: Schedule bearing inspection within 24 hours
Step 5: If temperature does not drop within 10 minutes — SHUT DOWN

─────────────────────────────────────

SYMPTOM: Vibration above 3.0 mm/s (WARNING)
Priority: Medium

Step 1: Check all mounting bolts with torque wrench
Step 2: Listen for unusual sounds (grinding = bearing failure)
Step 3: Check shaft alignment visually
Step 4: Add lubrication to bearing points
Step 5: Monitor for 30 minutes

SYMPTOM: Vibration above 4.0 mm/s (CRITICAL)
Priority: High

Step 1: Stop machine immediately for inspection
Step 2: Check bearing condition — look for heat discoloration
Step 3: Check shaft for visible damage or bending
Step 4: Replace bearings if any wear visible
Step 5: Do NOT restart until vibration cause identified

─────────────────────────────────────

SYMPTOM: Pressure below 3.0 bar (WARNING)
Priority: Medium

Step 1: Walk around machine checking for visible leaks
Step 2: Check inlet valve is fully open
Step 3: Bleed air from system using bleed valve
Step 4: Check filter — replace if clogged
Step 5: Monitor pressure for 15 minutes

SYMPTOM: Pressure below 2.5 bar (CRITICAL)
Priority: High

Step 1: Check all seals and gaskets for leakage
Step 2: Inspect pump impeller for wear or damage
Step 3: Pressure test all connections
Step 4: Replace seals if any leakage found
Step 5: If pressure cannot be restored — shut down and call senior technician

─────────────────────────────────────

CONTACT INFORMATION:
Senior Technician: +91-XXXXX-XXXXX
Maintenance Supervisor: +91-XXXXX-XXXXX
Spare Parts Store: Extension 204
Emergency Line: Extension 911

MAINTENANCE HISTORY LOG
=======================

Date: 2024-01-15 | Machine: PUMP_A
Issue: High vibration detected (3.8 mm/s)
Root Cause: Main bearing wear due to insufficient lubrication
Action Taken: Replaced main bearings, realigned shaft, added lubrication
Parts Used: Bearing set SKF-6205, alignment shims
Result: Vibration reduced to 1.9 mm/s
Downtime: 4 hours
Technician: Rajesh Kumar
Cost: ₹12,500

Date: 2024-01-28 | Machine: MOTOR_C
Issue: Temperature spike to 88°C during peak load
Root Cause: Blocked cooling fins with dust accumulation
Action Taken: Cleaned cooling fins, replaced coolant, checked fan operation
Parts Used: Industrial coolant 5L
Result: Temperature normalized to 68°C
Downtime: 2 hours
Technician: Priya Sharma
Cost: ₹3,200

Date: 2024-02-05 | Machine: COMPRESSOR_D
Issue: Pressure drop to 2.8 bar
Root Cause: Worn shaft seals causing air leakage
Action Taken: Replaced shaft seals, tightened all connections, pressure tested
Parts Used: Seal kit CS-204
Result: Pressure restored to 4.2 bar
Downtime: 3 hours
Technician: Amit Singh
Cost: ₹8,700

Date: 2024-02-10 | Machine: PUMP_B
Issue: Unusual noise during operation
Root Cause: Loose mounting bolts causing resonance vibration
Action Taken: Tightened all mounting bolts, added vibration dampeners
Parts Used: M16 bolts x8, rubber dampeners x4
Result: Noise eliminated, vibration reduced to 1.5 mm/s
Downtime: 1 hour
Technician: Rajesh Kumar
Cost: ₹1,800
